verses.verse: To the chief Musician, <WH5329> A Psalm <WH4210> of David. <WH1732> The king <WH4428> shall joy <WH8055> in thy strength, <WH5797> O LORD; <WH3068> and in thy salvation <WH3444> how <WH4100> greatly <WH3966> shall he rejoice! <WH1523>
Thou hast given <WH5414> him his heart's <WH3820> desire, <WH8378> and hast not <WH1077> withheld <WH4513> the request <WH782> of his lips. <WH8193> Selah. <WH5542>
For <WH3588> thou preventest <WH6923> him with the blessings <WH1293> of goodness: <WH2896> thou settest <WH7896> a crown <WH5850> of pure gold <WH6337> on his head. <WH7218>
He asked <WH7592> life <WH2416> of <WH4480> thee, and thou gavest <WH5414> it him, even length <WH753> of days <WH3117> forever <WH5769> and ever. <WH5703>
His glory <WH3519> is great <WH1419> in thy salvation: <WH3444> honor <WH1935> and majesty <WH1926> hast thou laid <WH7737> upon <WH5921> him.
For <WH3588> thou hast made <WH7896> him most blessed <WH1293> forever: <WH5703> thou hast made him exceeding glad <WH2302> <WH8057> with <WH854> thy countenance. <WH6440>
For <WH3588> the king <WH4428> trusteth <WH982> in the LORD, <WH3068> and through the mercy <WH2617> of the most High <WH5945> he shall not <WH1077> be moved. <WH4131>
Thine hand <WH3027> shall find out <WH4672> all <WH3605> thine enemies: <WH341> thy right hand <WH3225> shall find out <WH4672> those that hate <WH8130> thee.

Thou shalt make <WH7896> them as a fiery <WH784> oven <WH8574> in the time <WH6256> of thine anger: <WH6440> the LORD <WH3068> shall swallow them up <WH1104> in his wrath, <WH639> and the fire <WH784> shall devour <WH398> them.
Their fruit <WH6529> shalt thou destroy <WH6> from the earth, <WH4480> <WH776> and their seed <WH2233> from among the children <WH4480> <WH1121> of men. <WH120>
For <WH3588> they intended <WH5186> evil <WH7451> against <WH5921> thee: they imagined <WH2803> a mischievous device, <WH4209> which they are not <WH1077> able <WH3201> to perform.
Therefore <WH3588> shalt thou make <WH7896> them turn their back, <WH7926> when thou shalt make ready <WH3559> thine arrows upon thy strings <WH4340> against <WH5921> the face <WH6440> of them.
Be thou exalted, <WH7311> LORD, <WH3068> in thine own strength: <WH5797> so will we sing <WH7891> and praise <WH2167> thy power. <WH1369>
